admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific

abstracts.cdata!:
The Fourth Technical Cooperation Project
            aims to provide continued support to China in its economic
            and structural reform effort. The project consists of two
            components. The first component supports reform and
            institutional development. It supports strengthening the
            institutions involved in the Government's economic
            policies based on Government priorities, provides support to
            programs associated with policy reform; and strengthens the
            capacity of provincial finance bureaus and project
            implementing agencies to manage implementation of Bank and
            non-Bank financed projects involved in fostering sustainable
            development. The second component supports pre-investment
            and project preparation. It finances consultants'
            services, training, and equipment required for the
            preparation of feasibility studies. Subprojects under the
            first component include institutional strengthening of
            Chinese academic institutes and government agencies,
            demonstration zones, and finance bureaus. The second
            component includes subprojects concerned with sustainable
            forestry, water conservation, flood control, water supply,
            agricultural development, and river basin pollution.
